The decline of gun violence

This graph clearly shows a straight decline of gun violence in the previous years. That's obvious and datas don't lie, right?
Well they don't but the way we showcase them can be deceiving. Move the slider to reveal another truth. Truncated scales are a often used to portray a different reality. Watch how the axis and scales are revealing a much different story.


But what more ?

In this graph, it may be easy to see that black and white people are the major victims of gun deaths. But while these numbers are accurate, there are only one of the many ways to tell one's truth. Let's now rethink those numbers and put them in perspective of the race's total population in the United States. Are the results the same?

Different causes of gun deaths

Pie and donuts charts are commonly known as the worst kind of charts. Why is that? Simply because it's almost impossible for our brains to correctly estimate proportions and numbers on a distorted surface. Try to guess the percentages and then hover on the surfaces to see if you got it right.

And finally ?

Number of deaths from guns in 2014

Double-sided charts are sometimes difficult to read for two reasons. The first one is the double scale which may be counter intuitive. The second one is that, because one part of the graph is lobsided, it can be difficult for the human brain to correctly compare the two. Did you manage to see that there is always 1'000 more women that succomb to gun violence each month?
